definition: Qixi Festival or Double Seven Festival on the 7th day of the 7th lunar month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女[niu2 lang3 zhi1 nu:3] are allowed their annual meeting
seven/7
dusk/evening/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: My students have been working with the Star Festival.
sentences.chinese: 我的学生们一直在研习日本七夕节。

sentences.english: The Star Festival is an all-Chinese myth.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节来自一个中国的传说。

sentences.english: One of the most popular is "Tanabata", or "Star Festival", which happens on July 7.
sentences.chinese: 7月7日这天的“七夕节”是最受欢迎的庆典之一。

sentences.english: Chinese Valentine's Day is the most a romantic holiday of traditional festivals in China.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节是我国传统节日中最具浪漫色彩的一个节日。

sentences.english: Qixi is the origin of BOhai with splashing waters.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节的起源与溅渤海水域。

sentences.english: Is Qixi Festival more than a Chinese Valentine’s Day?
sentences.chinese: 七夕节仅仅是中国的情人节吗？

sentences.english: Today is the seventh day of the seventh lunar month, so, it is called Qixi.
sentences.chinese: 今天是农历的七月初七，所以叫七夕节。

sentences.english: But through it all you have always been my valentine.
sentences.chinese: 但经历过这一切的甘与苦，你七夕节传说是我的爱人。

sentences.english: Qixi also grasp chances to coordinately develop it economy.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节也抢抓机遇它经济协调发展。

sentences.english: Qixi Festival is the most romantic festival among all the Chinese traditional festivals.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节是我国传统节日中最浪漫的一个节日。

sentences.english: It is a Chinese custom, July 7th day girls gather together to worship seven sister.
sentences.chinese: 那是中国的习俗，七夕节女孩会聚在一起拜七姐。

sentences.english: It is a custom for Chinese to watch the Altair and Vega on the chairs.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节坐着仰望牵牛星和织女星是中国人的一个习俗。

definition: double seven festival, evening of seventh of lunar seventh month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed their annual meeting
Valentine's Day
White Day
Singles' Day (November 11), originally a day of activities for single people, but now also the world's biggest annual retail sales day
International Women's Day (March 8)
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
International Women's Day (March 8)
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
Mother's Day
the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
Silent Night (Christmas carol)/Christmas Eve
wedding anniversary
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
holiday/festival/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2]
